text: Daniel Burrill Ray (5 February 1928, Cleveland, Ohiobirthdate from D. B. Ray's Ph.D. dissertation – 19 February 1979) was an American mathematician. He is known for Ray-Singer torsion. Ray received his bachelor's degree summa cum laude in 1949 from Harvard College and his Ph.D. from Cornell University in 1953 under Mark Kac with thesis On Spectra of Second Order Differential Operators. As a postdoc he was a Frank B. Jewett Fellow in 1953/54 at Bell Laboratories.Bell Lab Records, March 1953 From 1957 to 1979 he was a professor at Massachusetts Institute of Technology.MIT mathematics faculty In 1958, 1959, 1960 and 1961 he was at the Institute for Advanced Study.Daniel B. Ray, Institute for Advanced Study He was a Sloan Fellow. ==Selected publications== * On spectra of second-order differential operators. Trans. Amer. Math.
